block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
FILM

Pleasantville ''50 Years of Janus Films,'' a series showcasing films by Bergman, Truffaut, Fellini, Kurosawa and others. Through Feb. 28. $6 to $13 per film; some films are followed by question-and-answer sessions. Schedule and information: burnsfilmcenter.org. Jacob Burns Film Center, 364 Manville Road. (914) 773-7663.
Poughkeepsie ''Raging Bull,'' directed by Martin Scorsese. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $5. Bardavon 1869 Opera House, 35 Market Street. (845) 473-2072.

Purchase ''Harlan Jacobson's Talk Cinema,'' screenings of new independent or foreign films, followed by discussions with guest speakers. Tuesday at 2 p.m. $20. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
FOR CHILDREN
Croton-on-Hudson Young People's Concert with the Artemis String Quartet; works by Mozart, Gershwin, Dvorak and others. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

Pleasantville ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' play about Emily Dickinson; presented by M & M productions. Feb. 4 at 2 p.m. Free. Mount Pleasant Public Library, 350 Bedford Road. (914) 769-0548.

Purchase Family concert to benefit the Food Bank for Westchester; with the Dream Jam Band and the Westchester Symphonic Winds. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. $10 and $20. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.

Rye ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' play about Emily Dickinson by Ward James Riley, by M & M Productions with YCP TheaterWorks. Jan. 28 at 4 p.m. Rye Free Reading Room, 1061 Boston Post Road. (914) 967-0480.
Valhalla Dance concert for children, presented by Danceworks, with audience participation. Jan. 28 at 3 p.m. $7. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' for children ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500 x360.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Beacon Till Fellner, pianist; works by Bach, Beethoven and Schubert; presented by the Howland Chamber Music Circle. Feb. 4 at 4 p.m. $25. Howland Cultural Center, 477 Main Street. (845) 297-9243.
Bronx Philadanco, modern dance. Jan. 28 at 3 p.m. $20 to $35. Lehman Center for the Performing Arts, 250 Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8833.
Chappaqua The Chappaqua Orchestra Wind Quartet; works by Mozart, Ligeti and others. Feb. 4 at 3 p.m. $15. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
Nyack ''The Rules of the Game,'' directed by Jean Renoir; in French, with English subtitles. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $6 and $8. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Peekskill Les Ballets Africains, African dance. Feb. 4 at 3 p.m. $25. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 930-7588.
Pleasantville ''Best of Broadway,'' presented by Be Mused Productions. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. Mount Pleasant Public Library, 350 Bedford Road. (914) 769-0548.
Poughkeepsie ''Modfest,'' festival of music, dance and art. Through Feb. 4. Free. Vassar College, (845) 437-7294.

Scarsdale Hoff-Barthelson Music School's Artist Series: The Oracle Trio; works by Mozart, Turina and Shostakovich. Friday at 8 p.m. $12 to $14. Scarsdale Community Baptist Church, Popham and Autenrieth Roads. (914) 723-1169.
South Salem The Atwater Donnelly Trio, folk, with Cathy Clasper-Torch, fiddle. Feb. 3 at 8 p.m. $10 and $12. South Salem Library, 15 Main Street. (914) 763-3857.
Tarrytown Anthony da Costa, folk. Feb. 3 at 8 p.m. Free. Coffee Labs, 7 Main Street. (914) 332-1479.

White Plains Prokofiev's ''Peter and the Wolf,'' with narration, presented with the Eastchester Arts Council. Sunday at 3 p.m. ''The Beat Goes On: Rhythms of Youth Theater Interactions,'' with African dances, music and a theatrical tribute to Langston Hughes. Thursday at 7 p.m. Mala Waldron, jazz vocalist. Feb. 3 at 7 p.m. $10 to $20. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, extension 223.
White Plains The Damocles Trio; works by Mozart, Salvador Brotons and Villa-Lobos. Jan. 28 at 3 p.m. $10 and $15. Community Unitarian Church, 468 Rosedale Avenue. (914) 232-3394.

White Plains Nancy Hambleton-Torrente, cellist, and Joy Plaisted, harpist; works by Ralph Vaughan Williams, Heitor Villa-Lobos and others; Wednesday at 12:10 p.m. Grace Church, 33 Church Street. (914) 949-2478.
White Plains Pete Malinverni, jazz pianist. Feb. 4 at 2:30 p.m. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
Yonkers ''Fugue,'' dance. Friday through Feb. 3 at 8 p.m. Free. Bessie Schoenberg Dance Theater, Sarah Lawrence College. (914) 395-2433.

Yonkers Mardi Gras Costume Ball, with music, dance lessons and food; with the Creole Cowboys, Jesse Lege and Bayou Brew. Feb. 3, 6:30 p.m. to midnight. $25 and $30. Philipsburgh Building, 2-8 Hudson Street. (914) 969-6660.
SPOKEN WORD
Pleasantville Celebrating Women Filmmakers Series: Christine Vachon, independent film producer. Tuesday at 7 p.m. $6 and $10. Jacob Burns Film Center, 364 Manville Road. (914) 773-7663.
THEATER

Mamaroneck ''Murder on the Nile,'' an adaptation of Agatha Christie's novel; a question-and-answer session follows the performances on Thursday and Feb. 8. Through Feb. 11. $26 to $35. Emelin Theater, 153 Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.
Mohegan Lake ''The Little Foxes,'' by Lillian Hellman, presented by YCP TheaterWorks. Through Feb. 4. $10 and $15. Van Cortlandtville School, Route 6. (914) 528-4145.
Tarrytown ''High School Musical,'' presented by the Random Farms Kids Theater. Friday through Feb. 11. $16 and $18. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Armonk ''Winter Solstice V: Expressions of Our Time and Place,'' group show. Through Jan. 28. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Beacon ''bau 25: bau NOW,'' group exhibition featuring sculpture, painting and mixed media. Through Feb. 4. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.
Beacon ''New Hudson 3, Contemporary Art of the Hudson Valley,'' group show. Through Feb. 26. Hours: daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Van Brunt Gallery, 460 Main Street. (845) 838-2995.
Bronx ''South Bronx Contemporary,'' group show. Through March 10. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Longwood Art Gallery at Hostos, 450 Grand Concourse, C-190. (718) 518-6728.
Dobbs Ferry ''Group Therapy,'' exhibition of recent works by Upstream Gallery members. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-8548.
Greenburgh Watercolors by students of Brigitte Loritz. Through Wednesday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Madeleine Gutman Gallery, 177 Hillside Avenue. (914) 682-1574.
Hartsdale DeSanti Plaza Sculpture Project:''Tinted Reflections II,'' sculpture by Anthony Krauss. Through March 1. DeSanti Plaza, across from Metro-North. (914) 478-4630.
Hudson ''In Our Name: Iraqi Children in War,'' paintings by Christine Heller. Through Feb. 25. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Hudson Opera House, 327 Warren Street. (518) 822-1438.

Katonah ''Paterson II,'' a new series of photographs by George Tice. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Candace Dwan Gallery, 27 Katonah Avenue. (914) 232-3966.

Katonah ''The Way Things Go,'' Video documenting a mad science experiment. ''Tools as Art: The Hechinger Collection,'' curated by Sarah Tanguy. Both through April 8. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Larchmont ''Just a Moment,'' photography by Sid Hecker. Through Tuesday. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.

New Rochelle ''Remembering the New York-Westchester-Boston Railway in New Rochelle,'' exhibit featuring artifacts, maps and photographs. Through Wednesday. ''My America: The African Diaspora in the Western Hemisphere,'' exhibition by James Brown and John Holyfield. Thursday through Feb. 28. Reception and gallery talk: Feb. 4 at 3 p.m. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays 9 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. New Rochelle Public Library, Lawton Street. (914) 632-7878.

Poughkeepsie ''For the People: American Mural Drawings of the 1930s and 1940s,'' group show. Through March 11. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Vassar College, Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center. (845) 437-5632.
Rye ''Cutting Across Cultures: The Art of Papercutting, Then and Now,'' works by traditional and contemporary paper-cutting artists. Through Feb. 17. Rye Arts Center, 51 Milton Road. (914) 967-0700.
Tarrytown ''Blues and Jazz Images,'' photography by Noel Brandel. Thursday through Feb. 28. Warner Public Library, 121 North Broadway. (914) 631-7734.

Valhalla ''Looser, Smoother, Faster,'' exhibition by Eric Hongisto, Shoji Kato and Matt King. Through Feb. 24. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 6 to 8 p.m. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.

White Plains ''Tapestry of the Diaspora: A Celebration of African American Heritage,'' group show. ''Clusters,'' sculpture installation by Jo-Ann Brody. Both Wednesday through March 10. Reception: Wednesday at 6 p.m. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, extension 223.

White Plains ''Once Upon a Time The Art of Children's Book Illustration,'' work of Howard Fine, Yumi Heo and Mary O'Keefe Young. Through Feb. 28. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
Woodstock ''Exhibit A,'' group show. Through Feb. 4. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Varga Gallery, 130 Tinker Street. (845) 679-4005.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.

Armonk ''Winter Solstice V: Expressions of Our Time and Place,'' group show. Through Jan. 28. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Beacon ''bau 25: bau NOW,'' group exhibition featuring sculpture, painting and mixed media. Through Feb. 4. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.
Beacon ''New Hudson 3, Contemporary Art of the Hudson Valley,'' group show. Through Feb. 26. Hours: daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Van Brunt Gallery, 460 Main Street. (845) 838-2995.
Bronx ''South Bronx Contemporary,'' group show. Through March 10. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Longwood Art Gallery at Hostos, 450 Grand Concourse, C-190. (718) 518-6728.
Dobbs Ferry ''Group Therapy,'' exhibition of recent works by Upstream Gallery members. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-8548.
Greenburgh Watercolors by students of Brigitte Loritz. Through Wednesday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Madeleine Gutman Gallery, 177 Hillside Avenue. (914) 682-1574.
Hartsdale DeSanti Plaza Sculpture Project:''Tinted Reflections II,'' sculpture by Anthony Krauss. Through March 1. DeSanti Plaza, across from Metro-North. (914) 478-4630.
Hudson ''In Our Name: Iraqi Children in War,'' paintings by Christine Heller. Through Feb. 25. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Hudson Opera House, 327 Warren Street. (518) 822-1438.

Katonah ''Paterson II,'' a new series of photographs by George Tice. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Candace Dwan Gallery, 27 Katonah Avenue. (914) 232-3966.

Katonah ''The Way Things Go,'' Video documenting a mad science experiment. ''Tools as Art: The Hechinger Collection,'' curated by Sarah Tanguy. Both through April 8. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Larchmont ''Just a Moment,'' photography by Sid Hecker. Through Tuesday. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.

New Rochelle ''Remembering the New York-Westchester-Boston Railway in New Rochelle,'' exhibit featuring artifacts, maps and photographs. Through Wednesday. ''My America: The African Diaspora in the Western Hemisphere,'' exhibition by James Brown and John Holyfield. Thursday through Feb. 28. Reception and gallery talk: Feb. 4 at 3 p.m. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays 9 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. New Rochelle Public Library, Lawton Street. (914) 632-7878.

Poughkeepsie ''For the People: American Mural Drawings of the 1930s and 1940s,'' group show. Through March 11. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Vassar College, Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center. (845) 437-5632.
Rye ''Cutting Across Cultures: The Art of Papercutting, Then and Now,'' works by traditional and contemporary paper-cutting artists. Through Feb. 17. Rye Arts Center, 51 Milton Road. (914) 967-0700.
Tarrytown ''Blues and Jazz Images,'' photography by Noel Brandel. Thursday through Feb. 28. Warner Public Library, 121 North Broadway. (914) 631-7734.

Valhalla ''Looser, Smoother, Faster,'' exhibition by Eric Hongisto, Shoji Kato and Matt King. Through Feb. 24. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 6 to 8 p.m. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.

White Plains ''Tapestry of the Diaspora: A Celebration of African American Heritage,'' group show. ''Clusters,'' sculpture installation by Jo-Ann Brody. Both Wednesday through March 10. Reception: Wednesday at 6 p.m. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, extension 223.

White Plains ''Once Upon a Time The Art of Children's Book Illustration,'' work of Howard Fine, Yumi Heo and Mary O'Keefe Young. Through Feb. 28. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
Woodstock ''Exhibit A,'' group show. Through Feb. 4. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Varga Gallery, 130 Tinker Street. (845) 679-4005.
